definition: to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research

sentences.english: Xylitol also appears to have potential as a treatment for osteoporosis.
sentences.chinese: 木糖醇似乎有治癒骨質疏鬆的潛力。

sentences.english: He also fixed a tennis elbow within no time.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時他還治癒了我的網球肘。

sentences.english: She said that, it is absolutely curable.
sentences.chinese: 古普塔表示，這是完全可以治癒的。

sentences.english: Time of detection greatly effects melanoma's cure rate.
sentences.chinese: 黑素瘤確診的時間早晚極大地影響着治癒的概率。

sentences.english: However, these actions will not cure the post-bubble hangover of the over-extended consumer.
sentences.chinese: 不過，這些行動不會治癒過度消費的後泡沫殘留影響。

sentences.english: He is also the author of Dr. Neal Barnard's Program for Reversing Diabetes.
sentences.chinese: 他還著有《巴納德醫生治癒糖尿病程序》一書。

sentences.english: But Barbara Fick says stored onions need to be cured first.
sentences.chinese: 但芭芭拉說菲克存儲蔥需要先治癒。

sentences.english: Personally, I do not want to be cured.
sentences.chinese: 從個人的角度來說，我不想被治癒。

sentences.english: When you approach Healer Yabo, you notice that she has a blue glow.
sentences.chinese: 當你的辦法治癒亞波，就會發現她有一個藍色輝光。

sentences.english: Time cured him of his grief.
sentences.chinese: 時光的流逝治癒了他的悲哀。

sentences.english: Conclusion Consolidate of anisometropia amblyopia have been cured is found to arrest palindromia.
sentences.chinese: 結論屈光參差性弱視治癒後的鞏固是預防復發的根本。

sentences.english: They have the ability to keep blood flowing which can be useful in tissues that doctors are trying to help heal.
sentences.chinese: 螞蟥可使血液流動，這對醫生想要治癒的組織有益。

sentences.english: Lesions which have crusted fully are considered healed and not active.
sentences.chinese: 已結痂的病損可以認爲是治癒或無活動的。

sentences.english: Result Onecourse of treatment cure rate up to 80%, always efficient 93%.
sentences.chinese: 結果一個療程治癒率達80%，總有效率93%。

sentences.english: You are the one that I can laugh when I dream of you.
sentences.chinese: 你是我治癒我心疾的良藥，夢見你時我都會笑。

definition: to recover completely (from illness or injury)
to reinstate/to resume/to restore/to recover/to regain/to rehabilitate
to improve/to take a turn for the better/improvement
